basics.name: Sundar Gurumurthy
basics.label: Computational Modelling Engineer
basics.summary: Early-career engineering professional with over 3 years of experience in Finite Element Analysis (FEA), specializing in process modelling and simulation. Strong academic background with a research-focused MSc and hands-on expertise in WAAM, gear design, and crash simulations.

work.name: Cranfield University
work.summary: Supporting advanced process modelling at the Welding and Additive Manufacturing Centre, specializing in WAAM for aerospace and energy applications.
highlights: Developed FEA models for WAAM (CW-MIG, PTA) to optimize microstructure and minimize defects.
Designed efficient deposition sequences using thermo-mechanical solvers for complex geometries.
Integrated martensitic transformation behavior in dissimilar metal deposition models.
Conducted WAAM experiments using SEM, thermal imaging, and 3D scanning techniques.

work.name: Sona Comstar
work.summary: Worked in the bevel gear design team of a global leader in drivetrain systems.
highlights: Optimized forged gear profiles using Bezier surface tools and CAD techniques.
Performed LTCA and NVH analyses for leading automotive OEMs.
Improved manufacturability through close collaboration with cross-functional teams.

work.name: Mercedes Benz R&D India
work.summary: Contributed to the Crash Structures team for automotive crash simulations.
highlights: Developed non-linear FE crash models of tires using LS-DYNA.
Assessed air pressure modeling and contact algorithms in crash scenarios.
Proposed and documented verification procedures for composite materials.

work.name: Daimler India Commercial Vehicles
work.summary: Supported End-of-Line operations for Mitsubishi FUSO trucks.
highlights: Conducted lean manufacturing analysis that improved rework efficiency by 0.5%.
Led root cause investigations and developed corrective actions for production defects.
